thread.title: Robinson III takes the Slam Dunk title
thread.title_full: Robinson III takes the Slam Dunk title

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Robinson III takes the Slam Dunk title
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Robinson III takes the Slam Dunk title Jumping over teammate Paul George for emphatic dunk was the highlight Post to Facebook Robinson III takes the Slam Dunk title Jumping over teammate Paul George for emphatic dunk was the highlight Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2lviaMB Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address.   Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Robinson III takes the Slam Dunk title Sam Amick , USA TODAY Sports 10:54 p.m. ET Feb. 18, 2017 Indiana Pacers forward Glenn Robinson III (40) competes in the slam dunk contest during NBA All-Star Saturday Night at Smoothie King Center. (Photo: Derick E. Hingle-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW ORLEANS – The oohs and aahs in the Smoothie King Center said it all. 
Glenn Robinson III, thanks to a perfect score dunk in the final round of the NBA Slam Dunk Contest, was the winner. 
The Indiana Pacers shooting guard ran from the right and soared up and over his teammate, Paul George, grabbing the ball on the way and floating long enough to clear the Pacers mascot and a dancer too. His reverse slam, with his head grazing the rim along the way, was enough to win the event that, while entertaining, was nowhere near electric as last year’s legendary affair. 
Robinson III beat the Phoenix Suns’ Derrick Jones Jr. in the final round, while also taking out the Los Angeles Clippers’ DeAndre Jordan and the Orlando Magic’s Aaron Gordon along the way. Facebook   1984: Larry Nance of the Phoenix Suns dunks one ball after another during 1984 competition. Nance won the contest, which was the first in the NBA. Porter Binks, USAT 1986: Despite his diminutive stature, Spud Webb would go on to win the 1986 Slam Dunk Contest in dazzling fashion. USA TODAY Sports 1988: Michael Jordan attempts his "Rock the Cradle" dunk during the 1988 competition in Chicago. He would take home the trophy that year. John Swart, AP 1991: Dee Brown goes up for a no-look slam dunk during the Slam Dunk Contest in Charlotte. Brown would win the contest that year. Nathaniel S. Butler, NBAE/Getty Images 1994: Isaiah "JR" Rider of the skies for a slam dunk during the 1994 Slam Dunk Contest. He is most remembered for his "East Bay Funk" dunk in the contest, which he would win. Nathaniel S. Butler, NBAE/Getty Images 1996: Kobe Bryant attempts a one-handed dunk during the 1996 Slam Dunk Contest. He would go on to win it that year. Andrew D. Bernstein, NBAE/Getty Images 2000: Toronto's Vince Carter passes the ball between his legs as he hangs in the air during the NBA Slam Dunk Contest. Carter won the competition. ROBERT HANASHIRO, USAT 2000: Steve Francis goes up for a reverse dunk. Despite his display of athleticism, Vince Carter would come away the winner of the competition. ROBERT HANASHIRO, USAT 2000: Tracy McGrady throws down a dunk during the 2000 Slam Dunk Contest. Despite that, he would fall to his cousin, Vince Carter, in the competition. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY Sports 2000: Vince Carter sticks his arm in the rim after dunking. This dunk would be referred to as the "Honey Dip." Carter won the competition. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY Sports 2002: Jason Richardson goes for a reverse dunk during the Slam Dunk Contest in Philadelphia. Richardson won the contest. Nathaniel S. Butler, NBAE/Getty Images 2004: Fred Jones of the Indiana Pacers won the Slam Dunk Contest beating two time champion Jason Richardson of the Golden State Warriors in a miss-filled dunk contest in Los Angeles. Dan MacMedan, USA TODAY Sports 2005: Josh Smith dons an old-time Atlanta Hawks jersey in honor of Dominique Wilkins during the NBA Rising Stars Slam Dunk contest in Denver. He would go on to win the contest. Michael Madrid, USA TODAY Sports 2005: Amare Stoudemire goes between the legs during the Slam Dunk Contest held in Denver. Josh Smith would come out the victor that year. Michael Madrid, USA TODAY Sports 2005: Josh Smith jumps over Kenyon Martin during the Slam Dunk Contest. Michael Madrid, USA TODAY Sports 2007: Gerald Green jumps over Nate Robinson of the New York Knicks, during the slam dunk contest during NBA All-Star weekend in Las Vegas. He would finish the contest as the winner. Kevork Djansezian, AP 2007: Gerald Green leaps over a table on his dunk in the finals of the NBA Slam Dunk Contest. Green won the competition, beating out eventual three-time winner, Nate Robinson. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY Sports 2008: Dwight Howard attempts a dunk from the free throw line with Superman outfit on. Howard's showmanship would lead to a victory in the contest. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports 2009: Dwight Howard emerges from a phone booth with a Superman cape on. Despite his theatrics, he would lose to Nate Robinson. Andrew D. Bernstein, NBAE/Getty Images 2009: Nate Robinson leaps over Dwight Howard en route to his second Slam Dunk Contest victory. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY Sports 2011: Blake Griffin emulates Vince Carter's "Honey Dip" dunk 11 years prior by sticking his arm into the basket. Griffin would win the contest that year. Mark J. Terrill, AP 2011: Oklahoma City's Serge Ibaka grabs a toy off the rim with his teeth during the Sprite Slam Dunk contest, part of the 2011 NBA All Star weekend in Los Angeles. However, Blake Griffin would win the competition. Robert Hanashiro, USAT 2011: Blake Griffin from dunks over a car with Baron Davis inside before winning the All-Star Slam Dunk Contest. Mark Ralston, AFP/Getty Images 2013: Terrence Ross attempts a behind-the-back dunk during the 2013 contest. Ross would win the contest. Brett Davis, USA TODAY Sports 2015: Zach LaVine brings the ball behind his back, toward his knees, for a dunk during the 2015 Slam Dunk Contest in Brooklyn. LaVine would take home the title that year. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports 2016: Zach LaVine took home the title for the second year in a row, winning the contest in Toronto. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
